CharacterCreationOption.OptionFlavourText: Vašyja baćki addana słužyli hrafu Haŭpt-Andersanu, jany nie byli bujnymi šlachcičami, ale zajmali značnaje stanovišča pry pałacy Hrafa-Elektara i zabiaśpiečyli vam kamfortnaje dziacinstva.
Vašy baćka nia tolki ŭdała słužyŭ, ale i vyžyvaŭ dosyć doŭha, kab atrymać pasadu siaržanta, vieterana, što pralivaŭ kroŭ jak źvieraludziej, hetak i bandytaŭ.
Nie ŭsio ŭ Impieryi błasłaŭlonyja Ranaldam, vašaja siamja była biednaj i zarablała na žyćcio chutkimi rukami i kiemlivaściu. Jana krała maniety z adkrytych kišeniaŭ i zasoŭvali ich u svaje.
Vino - kroŭ Vurtbada. Vašaja siamja zarablała na jaho handli vyšej pa race Šcir i ŭsioj Impieryi. Vašaje malenstva było źviazana sa stałymi vandroŭkami.
Źvieraludy i bandyty kvitniejuć u Impieryi. Tamu vašy dom zaŭždy mieŭ patrebu ŭ dužych mužčynach. U rychtoŭlach z rušeńniem vy nieŭzabavie zdabyli mocnyja ruki i hust da bojki.

Handlar, što prajazžaŭ la vašaj chaty, zaŭvažyŭ vašyja zdolnaści da ličbaŭ i ŭziaŭ vas pad svajo kryło. Jon prapanavaŭ navučyć vas svajmu ramiastvu ŭ pamien na štodzionnuju dapamohu ŭ vykanańni jaho zadańniaŭ.

Kanflikty ŭ Impieryi nie spynialisia ni na chvilinu, jak i praca jaje kavaloŭ. Pad kiraŭnictvam miascovaha kavala vy vyrašyli pieratvaryć svaju siłu ŭ ramiastvo i stali kuć žaleza pa svajmu žadańniu. Vašy pieršy mieč, chacia i atrymaŭsia kryvym, ale zatoje vostrym!
Bolšuju častku času vy bavili ŭ chramavym rajonie i malilisia roznym baham Impierskaha Panteona. Niekatoryja z tamtejšych śviataroŭ źviarnuli na vas svaju ŭvahu i stali vučyć vas svaim pisańniam.
Historyi pra Kalehii Nulna zaŭždy byli vašymi ŭpadabanymi, zdajecca, Ranald błasłaviŭ vas, kali Majstar-Inžynier, jaki šukaŭ vučnia, vyrašyŭ, što vy budziecie idealnym kandydatam.

Bojki i vypiŭka - što jašče treba ŭ žyćci? Z miačom u ruce vy maršavali sa svajoj raznašersnaj Volnaj Kampanijaj ad bitvy da bitvy i zarablali svaju ščyruju dolu šnaraŭ. Vy hatovyja słužyć kožnamu šlachciču za adpaviedny košt.
Zdolnaści da Viatroŭ Mahii dazvolili vam zaniać miesca ŭ Kalehijach Altdorfa, z časam vy navučylisia karystacca asnovami svajoj siły i paznali naturu svajho vietru.

Pryśviaciŭšy žyćcio kultu svajho boha-zastupnika, vy šukajecie šlach praviednaści ŭ adpaviednaści sa svajoj vieraj. Być Akalitam - značyć hartavać siabie suprać zła, nienaturalnaha i žachlivaha (Daje dostup da Malitvaŭ, ale nie daje vučyć Zaklony).

Jeraś była bizunom dobrych ludziej Impieryi, hniłatoj, ad jakoj treba było pazbavicca. Vyvučajučy majsterstva Palaŭničych na Viadźmarak, vy rychtavalisia sustrecca z usimi vidami niazbožnych źviaroŭ i mahaŭ, z vieraj i srebram.
U Impieryi šmat handlovych tavaraŭ, i vy vyrašyli zaniać svajo miesca siarod šmatlikich handlaroŭ. Na zaaščadžanyja hrošy vy źbirajeciesia stvaryć svoj ułasny karavan i zrabić sabie imia.
Słavalubstva zahubiła mnohich, i vašaja siamja apynułasia nie ŭ litaści z Elektaram. Vyhnanaja ŭ Silvaniju z drobnym bahaćciem, vašaja siamja była vymušana žyć siarod viaskoŭcaŭ.
Vy naradzilisia ŭ siamji Stryhanaŭ. Vašaje dziacinstva prajšło ŭ padarožžach z horada ŭ horad razam z karavanam kłana.

U Silvanii majucca tyja, chto dobra płacić za trupy, i vašaja siamja vybrała mienavita hetaje ramiastvo. Vykradali kachanych ludziej hłubokaj nočču i vieźli ich u zamki ci trymańni šlachty, nikoli nie zadajučy sabie pytańnie, navošta toje patrebna.

Na praciahu šmatlikich pakaleńniaŭ vašaja siamja łaviła rybu ŭ rekach i bahnavych łužynach, kab pracharčavacca. Heta było daloka nie bahataje žyćcio, ale heta była sumlennaja praca, i vašaja siamja była zadavolena. Navat paśla źniknieńnia vašaha brata...

Vy nikoli nia viedali pra svaju siamju, chacia mnohija hladzieli na vas sa stracham i šaptalisia napaŭhołasu, i vam zastavałasia tolki zmahacca za vyžyvańnie, zdabyvać sabie pražytak i siłkavacca čužymi zjedkami. Vam časta davadziłasia chavacca ad stvareńniaŭ, što chavajucca ŭnačy.
Słužba ŭ pałacy fon Karštajnaŭ dała vam ujaŭleńnie pra pobyt viečna žyvych, a chitrasplacieńni i palityki šlachty navučyli vas mnohamu. Vašaja starannaść dapamahła vam vyžyć i pačuvacca kamfortna.

Pra ćviarozy rozum vašaha majstara nielha šmat skazać: usie jaho dni byli pryśviečany raskryćciu skrutkaŭ i praviadzieńniu ciomnych rytuałaŭ. Apantany žadańniem stać mahutnym, ale nia majučy takoj mahčymasci, jon imknuŭsia karystacca vašymi zdolnaściami dziela ŭzmacnieńnia ŭłasnych.
Kapańnie bahnavaj hleby z brudnymi adkidami - nialohki zaniatak. Ale heta dazvalała vam i vašaj vioscy źbirać biedny ŭradžaj z prydatnych dla ziemlarobstva ziemlaŭ.

Zaklikany ŭ vojska svajho majstara, vy praviali svajo junactva na poli boju. Vajujučy razam z žachami niežyci i niekratyčnymi brydotami. Ale vy niejkim čynam zastalisia žyvyja i možacie raskazać pra hetaje.
Hojsajučy pa ŭskrajkam łahieraŭ, vy padhladvali lohkija zdabyčy i maładych dziaŭčyn dy, karystaliś svaimi spakuslivymi i debašyrskimi pavodzinami, kab zajmacca ramiastvom.

U niejki momant vašy vaładar raspaznaŭ vašyja jakaści, vyvieŭ vas z halečy i adkryŭ svaju sapraŭdnuju isnaść. Paśla pacałunka kryvi vy adradzilisia, zrabilisia nieśmiarotnym i bolš mahutnym. - Daje zdolnaść vyvučać zaklony i ŭzdymać miortvych paśla boju i na mohiłkach. Napačatku hulni vy musicie abrać kreŭnuju liniju.

Niečakana zjaviłasia mahčymaść skraści staražytny falijant viedaŭ. Tak vy stali na šlach niekramantyi - Daje dostup da zaklonaŭ, vykliku kaściakoŭ i zdolnaści ŭzdymać miortvych paśla boju ci na mohiłkach.

Śmiarotnych časta zaklikajuć słužyć svaim miortvym majstram. Zrazumieła, što hetyja prafiesijnyja vajary iduć u boj razam z proćmaj niežyci svaich majstraŭ. Bolš panurych i zababonnych ludziej składana sustreć, ale jany redka łamajucca ŭ zapału bitvy.

Chacia Donmu nie ŭpłyvovyja ŭ paraŭnańni z matryjarchami svajho kłanu, jany zjaŭlajucca važnymi čalcami hramadstva Stryhanaŭ. Bo padtrymlivajuć zhurtavanasć siamji i zjaŭlajucca tvaram kłana padčas kamunikavańnia z čužyncami. Chacia jany nia zjaŭlajucca prafiesijnymi vajarami, ich šmathadovaja praca na čale karavanaŭ u Starym Sviecie nie daje nahody dla pahardy nad imi.

Darohi Silvanii ciomnyja i niebiaśpiečnyja, vy palujecie na jaje małalikich vandraŭnikoŭ i zabirajecie sabie toje małaje bahaćcie, jakoje možacie zabrać svaim lazom. Ale vy nie adzinaja pačvara, jakaja chavajecca ŭ ciomnych bahnach i lasach: časam ad padarožnikaŭ nie zastajecca ničoha, što lha skraści.

Your family can trace its various roots and relations nearly as far back as the time of Gilles. You were born into the nobility of Bretonnia; and everyone knows it by the way you dress, the way you talk and the way you order the peasants about.

For untold generations, your family has worked the land of your feudal lord. Your father gave up long ago at trying to understand your lords words and simply look to the Yeoman who always accompanies him for orders, which normally involves great physical labour.

Your father was a sailor on a Bretonnian Buccaneer. When he returned to your fishing village, he spent as much time as he could with your mother, you and your siblings. He taught you as many skills as he could, such as knot tying, the use of a spyglass and how to navigate by the night sky.

Somehow, your family broke one of the oath bonds to your lord and has since been branded as outlaws. Constantly on the run and living at the fringe of society, your family makes due with what they can poach from the forests.

Your family was a part of the very small number of wealthy peasants that exist in Bretonnia. They gained their wealth over the generations through the sale of the many Bretonnian vintages into the Empire, Estalia and Tilea. Recently, your lord granted an exemption to the Sumptuary laws, enabling you to wear boots that reach to your knees.
For years, you were groomed to be the best Bretonnian noble you could be. This included lessons in manners, horsemanship and chivalry.

When you came of age, you entered the service of your lord. You were trained to hold the line and survive on the battlefield the best you can. You are still alive now, so you must have been pretty good at it.

In your youthful rashness, you broke one of the many laws setting the boundaries of Bretonnian society. Without any other options, you were forced into the fringe of society, forever on the run from the authorities. You lived for a time only by your poaching and stealing, while eventually finding forgiveness for your crimes.

Your father was able to get you an apprenticeship with one of the local artisans. Over the course of five years your master taught you everything he could, leaving you with skills that would forever put you above the average peasant.

You became a shepherd, watching over the various livestock that your community relied upon for food and clothing. You and your fellows in essence served two roles, protecting the herds from wolves and other predators, while also watching at the outskirts of the village for signs of invaders.

You have chosen to set out on the path of a knight of Bretonnia. The trail of dutiful chivalry is a hard one - many foes and battles await you. But, if you are worthy, at the end of your quest you will receive the greatest blessing known to men; a sip from the Grail of the Lady.

Earlier in your life, the Fay Enchantress visited your family and took you away. She saw within you a great potential and you joined her other students. After years of training she has deemed you ready to ride out, to serve the will of the Lady.
You proved your worth to your lord and he rewarded you with the title of Yeoman. As such, you were at times placed in command of other peasants or expected to act as an outrider while on campaign.

With licence of movement and a sense to improve yourself, you found yourself free of a direct lord and able to make something of yourself. With some skill in craft or luck in trade, you may yet make yourself a peasant worthy of sumptuary exemptions.

You were the apprentice of a Wall Warden for some time. You helped him evaluate damage and maintain the castle of your lord. When your master was killed during an assault on the castle walls, you became the Wall Warden. After a small mistake however, your lord has released you from your bond to find someone with more expertise.

You parents were of the ‘Nobility in Mousillon, if they can be called that. Nobles here are mostly made up of outlawed Bretonnian nobles, exiles and rouges from other nations, vampires, mummies and other varied monstrosities. While certainly at the top of Mousillan society, outside of the blighted land they are looked down upon the same as anyone else from here.

Your father was a Yeoman for one of the lords in the cursed dukedom. His position was one of the few that ensured your family dry lodgings and decent food, most of the time. When he was not on campaign he would do his best to teach you some fighting skills.

Trade in and out of Mousillon is nearly impossible due to the Cordon Sanitaire. Despite this, your family became skilled at smuggling goods past the gates and their guards. While not wealthy by most standards, for Mousillon you certainly were born with a silver spoon.

Somehow, your family broke one of the oath bonds to your lord and has since been branded as outlaws. Constantly on the run and living at the fringe of society, your family makes due with what they can poach from the forests.

One of the most common professions of Mousillon, your family was a rough bunch, who used their strength and wits to take advantage of the many weak and foolish people you found yourself living amongst.
For years, you were groomed to be the best Mousillan noble you could be. This included lessons in manners, horsemanship and chivalry.
Witchcraft and Magic is rife in Mousillon. You became a student of one of these practitioners and worked on brews and potions until you were trusted to learn more arcane knowledge.

When you came of age, you entered the service of your lord. You were trained to hold the line and survive on the battlefield the best you can. You are still alive now, so you must have been pretty good at it.

You spent your time hunting frogs and snails in the swamps and bogs to support your family. It is a tricky task that requires some skill and quickness to your fingers but snails and frogs are one of the few resources that your land is rich in.

Waiting along the high roads and near ferries, you made a living ambushing passersby and demanding their possessions. It is not an easy life, but youd rather lead your own life than those of your victims
Nothing says that a man of Mousillon cannot walk the path of a Bretonnian Knight. Where that path leads is as always reliant on the will and purity of the individual who walks it.
The swamps prevent the land of chivalry from exerting their control over the cursed dukedom, as a result many nerdowells find a kind of sanctuary in Mousillon, even the lords of the night.
Witches and Warlocks, Hedgefolk and Daemonologists, Wisewomen and Strigany; In a nearly lawless and accursed land such as Mousillon, whats one more who defies the will of Morr?

Things arrive in Mousillon that would be confiscated in any other port of the Oldworld. Wyrdstone, strange drugs, slaves, stolen goods, pirated ships and much much more and far darker. Someone has to take these items to their arranged buyers, who are almost always located outside of Mousillon. That means, you need someone who can get these items past the Cordon Sanitaire

The Foggy river heads and boggy bays of Mousillon make great hideouts for those of a less than legitimate profession. Bretonnian vessels are some of the best in the world, and are often laden with fabulous and valuable goods. That these vessels often have to ply the waters of the coast of Mousillon creates many opportunities for those willing to ‘seize them.
